Time since taking oral contraceptives is a **input factor**. It means that it is one of the inputs from the user to the model.

#### Alternative names:
* OCP end
* Time since OCP
* Time since taking oral contraceptives
* OralContraceptiveStopped

#### Uses

Time since taking oral contraceptives is used by the model in the following places

* [Ever used oral contraceptives](/model/OralContraceptiveEver)
* [Time since taking OCP per year](/model/OralContraceptiveSinceStop)

#### Guidance

The user input is a typed number and should answer the question

> How much time has passed since you stopped taking oral contraceptives?

The unit of the input is **Years**.

The answer has to be larger than 0 Years. The answer is recommended to be larger than 0 Years and smaller than 110 Years. Oral contraceptives are also called birth control pills and are used to preven pregnancies.


### Optimizability

[Optimizability](/model/optimizabilities) is a subjective measure used to describe how easy it is to optimize a certain factor of your life. The optimizability of Time since taking oral contraceptives is 3. This means that it can be interpreted as

> *It is impossible to change now, but it has once definitely been in your control*
